lynx://start.title: Lynx Start Page
lynx://start.content:
LYNX BROWSER - START PAGE
  =========================

  Welcome to Lynx, the text-based web browser.

  Available Sites:
  ----------------

  [1]Debian CDE Home - Main project page
  [2]GNU Project - Free software foundation
  [3]Debian Linux - Universal operating system
  [4]About Lynx - Information about this browser

  Navigation Help:
  ----------------
  * Use arrow keys (↑↓) to move between links
  * Press Enter or → to follow a link
  * Press ← to go back
  * Press G to enter a URL directly
  * Press H for help
  * Press Q to quit

  Type a number (1-4) to visit a site directly.

debian.com.mx.title: DEBIAN CDE - Common Desktop Environment
debian.com.mx.content:
DEBIAN CDE - COMMON DESKTOP ENVIRONMENT
  =======================================

  A pixel-perfect recreation of the Common Desktop Environment
  running in your browser.

  Navigation:
  [1]Home  [2]Documentation  [3]GitHub  [4]About

  Features:
  * [5]Getting Started Guide
  * [6]User Documentation
  * [7]Keyboard Shortcuts
  * [8]Workspaces Guide
  * [9]Terminal Laboratory

  Applications:
  * [10]XEmacs Text Editor
  * [11]File Manager
  * [12]Netscape Navigator
  * [13]Style Manager
  * [14]Process Monitor

  External Links:
  * [15]GitHub Repository
  * [16]GNU Project
  * [17]Debian Linux

  [18]← Back to Start Page

about:lynx.title: About Lynx
about:lynx.content:
ABOUT LYNX
  ==========

  Lynx Version 2.8.9rel.1 (25 May 2014)
  Built on Linux debian 5.10.0-20-amd64

  Lynx is a fully-featured World Wide Web (WWW) client for
  users running cursor-addressable, character-cell display
  devices (e.g., vt100 terminals, terminal emulators).

  It will display Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) documents
  containing links to files on the local system, as well as
  files on remote systems running http, gopher, ftp, wais,
  nntp, finger, or cso/ph/qi servers.

  Lynx can be used to access information on the WWW, or to
  build information systems intended primarily for local
  access.

  Copyright (C) 1997-2014 Thomas E. Dickey
  Copyright (C) 1994-1996 University of Kansas

  [1]Back to Start Page
  [2]Debian CDE Home

  Press 'g' to enter a new URL
  Press 'q' to quit

gnu.org.title: The GNU Operating System
gnu.org.content:
THE GNU OPERATING SYSTEM
  ========================

  [IMAGE: GNU Head]

  The GNU Project
  ---------------

  The GNU Project was launched in 1984 to develop a complete
  Unix-like operating system which is free software: the GNU
  system.

  What is Free Software?
  ----------------------

  "Free software" means software that respects users' freedom
  and community. The users have the freedom to run, copy,
  distribute, study, change and improve the software.

  Navigation:
  [1]Philosophy  [2]Licenses  [3]Software  [4]Documentation

  GNU Software:
  * [5]GNU Emacs - Extensible text editor
  * [6]GCC - GNU Compiler Collection
  * [7]GNU Bash - Bourne Again Shell
  * [8]GNU Coreutils - Core utilities

  [9]Back to Start Page
  [10]Debian CDE Home

debian.org.title: Debian -- The Universal Operating System
debian.org.content:
DEBIAN GNU/LINUX
  ================

  The Universal Operating System

  Debian is a free operating system (OS) for your computer.
  An operating system is the set of basic programs and
  utilities that make your computer run.

  Why Debian?
  -----------

  * Free: Debian is completely free software
  * Stable: Rock-solid reliability
  * Secure: Security updates and patches
  * Universal: Runs on many architectures

  Navigation:
  [1]About  [2]Getting Debian  [3]Support  [4]Developers

  Latest News:
  * [5]Debian 11 "Bullseye" released
  * [6]Security Advisory DSA-4xxx
  * [7]New packages in stable

  [8]Back to Start Page
  [9]Debian CDE Home
